abstract: The death of the paper airline ticket is finally at hand.
snippet: The death of the paper airline ticket is finally at hand.
lead_paragraph: It’s a rare and exotic thing these days to see someone at an airport holding a paper ticket, especially the old multi-layered red-inked carbon copy variety that remind us of when PanAm was still in business. People with paper tickets are like the conspicuous outliers at Home Depot who clog the line by trying to pay with cash.

headline.main: They Lasted Longer Than Airline Meals Did
